intro: Anarrhinum tenellum, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Anarrhinum tenellum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland sandy habitats.
